citation: Department of Health Care Access and Information Patient Discharge Data, 2012-2015
description: This dataset contains risk-adjusted mortality rates, expected mortality rates, observed mortality rates, quality ratings, and the number of deaths and cases for hip fracture repair performed in California hospitals. This dataset does not include the procedure performed in outpatient settings.
name: mortality-following-hip-fracture-repair-in-california-hospitals

resources.description: This dataset contains risk-adjusted mortality rates, expected mortality rates, observed mortality rates, quality ratings, and the number of deaths and cases for hip fracture repair performed in California hospitals. This dataset does not include the procedure performed in outpatient settings.
resources.name: mortality-following-hip-fracture-repair-in-california-hospitals-csv

fields.description: County in which the hospital is located
fields.name: County
fields.title: County

fields.description: A unique number established by the Department of Health Care Access and Information (HCAI) for identifying facilities and used in the Licensed Facility Information System (LFIS).  The first three numbers identify the type of facility, the next two represent the county number, and the last five are randomly assigned within each county.
fields.name: OSHPDID
fields.title: OSHPDID

fields.description: Number of patients who had hip fracture repair in this hospital
fields.name: # of Cases
fields.title: # of Cases

fields.description: Number of hip fracture repair patients who died within 30 days of admission to this hospital
fields.name: # of Deaths
fields.title: # of Deaths

fields.description: Observed hip fracture repair mortality rate in this hospital
fields.name: Observed Rate
fields.title: Observed Rate

fields.description: The expected hip fracture repair mortality rate in this hospital if they had a mix of patients that was comparable to the average hospital in California
fields.name: Expected Rate
fields.title: Expected Rate

fields.description: The Risk Adjusted Mortality Rates (RAMR) presented here adjusts the observed mortality rates. This statistical methodology takes into account pre-existing health problems that put some patients at greater risk of death to “level the playing field” and allow fair comparisons across hospitals.
fields.name: Risk Adjusted Mortality Rate
fields.title: Risk Adjusted Mortality Rate

fields.description:
Comparison rating based on a 98% Confidence Interval (CI). If a hospital’s upper CI is less than the statewide observed rate, it is designated as performing “better” than the average hospital. If a hospital’s lower CI is greater than the state rate, it is designated as performing “worse” than the average state hospital.
 1=Better
-1=Worse
 .=Average
fields.name: Hospital Ratings
fields.title: Hospital Ratings
